content: Great post, but you’ve just described what many of us of think as: User Centered Design. It’s a design philosophy based on an 80/20 objective of solving the main success scenario, from end-to-end, first and foremost, and not worrying about edge cases or anecdotal feature requests in the design. I tell clients that real success in the customer journey is rare; in my experience it only happens when you seriously narrow the scope.
